definition: to take a walk/to go for a walk
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: One day while a rabbit was walking by a hill he heard someone calling.
sentences.chinese: 一天当兔子在山角下散步时，听到有人在呼救。

sentences.english: He was walking by the sea when he heard a voice for help.
sentences.chinese: 他正在海边散步，这时突然听到呼救声。

sentences.english: I'll come walking with you in an hour or so.
sentences.chinese: 我大约一个钟头以后就来陪你散步。

sentences.english: When we was walking on the beach, we saw many sea-shells.
sentences.chinese: 当我闪在海滩上散步时，我们看到我许多贝壳。

sentences.english: We walk around the neighborhood. We learn street names and addresses.
sentences.chinese: 我们在家附近散步，我们学习街道的名字和地址。

sentences.english: Pictured here: A couple walks through the Lavaux Vineyard Terraces along Lake Geneva in Switzerland.
sentences.chinese: 图为一对夫妇沿瑞士日内瓦湖在拉沃克斯葡萄园散步。

sentences.english: When he is walking in the grass, Big Lion catches him.
sentences.chinese: 当他在草丛里面散步的时候，大狮子逮住了他。

sentences.english: Or I have been walking around with unexpressed anger for days.
sentences.chinese: 或者我这几天在外散步没有把愤怒表达出来。

sentences.english: The fineness of the skies tempt her to walk on the beach.
sentences.chinese: 晴朗的天空使她很想去海滩散步。

sentences.english: He walks really well on the leash, stopping every so often to rest or smell all sorts things.
sentences.chinese: 牠很适应颈绳散步有时会停停走走闻东闻西。

sentences.english: They talked as they walked around the park.
sentences.chinese: 他们边在公园里散步边说话。

sentences.english: The boys were as good as gold on our walk.
sentences.chinese: 我们散步的时候，这帮小男孩表现得很乖。

sentences.english: The third time we met, we were strolling along the beach in the moonlight.
sentences.chinese: 第三次在月亮升起时，他约我去海边散步。

sentences.english: LuoXiaoChun to gu buildings to the hospital to send food taken late at night, two people came to the yard for a walk.
sentences.chinese: 骆晓春到医院给顾阡陌送夜宵，两人来到院子散步。

sentences.english: That day, I am riding the baby carriage and mother go to the garden to take a walk.
sentences.chinese: 那天，我骑着童车与妈妈去街心花园散步。

sentences.english: We frightened two birds when we were walking in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 我们在树林里散步时惊起了两只鸟。

definition: (dialect) to take a walk/to go for a stroll
to take a dog for a walk
erhua variant of 遛彎|遛弯[liu4 wan1]
to stroll/to go for a walk
to be in the sun (getting warm or sunbathing etc)/to put sth in the sun (e.g. to dry it)
to run/to jog/(military) to march at the double
to take a walk/to window-shop/to stroll down the street
